meanings.definition: To explain or go over something excessively or to an unnecessary extent.
meanings.sent1: She belabors the point by repeating the same information over and over.
meanings.sent2: The teacher belabors the lesson to ensure everyone understands.
meanings.sent3: He belabors the instructions so much that we all end up confused.
meanings.sent4: The speaker belabors the topic until it loses all meaning.
meanings.sent5: Her constant belaboring of the issue makes it hard to focus on anything else.

meanings.definition: To attack or criticize someone repeatedly or harshly.
meanings.sent1: The bully belabors his victim with hurtful words every day.
meanings.sent2: The critic belabors the actor's performance in every review.
meanings.sent3: She belabors her brother's mistakes in a way that is more annoying than helpful.
meanings.sent4: His words belabor her like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The coach belabors the players with constant criticism, hoping to improve their skills.
